required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of SHR8008 vs. Fluconazole in Subjects With Acute Vulvovaginal Candidiasis
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Double-Dummy, Parallel-Group, Fluconazole Controlled, Multicenter Phase III Clinical Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of SHR8008 vs. Fluconazole in Subjects With Acute Vulvovaginal Candidiasis (VVC)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of SHR8008 vs. Fluconazole In Subjects with Acute vulvovaginal Candidiasis

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Double-Dummy, Parallel-Group, Fluconazole Controlled, Multicenter Phase III Clinical Study
study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: The proportion of subjects with therapeutic cure
primary_outcome.description: defined as absence of signs and symptoms of VVC plus negative culture of vaginal swabs for growth of Candida species

secondary_outcome.measure: The proportion of subjects therapeutic cure
The proportion of subjects with clinical cure
secondary_outcome.description: defined as absence of signs and symptoms of VVC

secondary_outcome.measure: The proportion of subjects with mycological cure
secondary_outcome.description: defined as negative culture of vaginal swabs for growth of Candida species

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline in VVC signs and symptoms score
The proportion of subjects receiving rescue therapy during the study

intervention.description: once daily for 2 days(Day 1 and Day 2),oral
